adjective.description: (of two or more subjects) similar to each other.
examples: the brothers were very much alike

adverb.description: In the same or a similar way.
examples: they dressed alike in black pants and jackets

origin: Old English gelīc, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch gelijk and German gleich, reinforced in Middle English by Old Norse álíkr (adjective) and álíka (adverb).
